sections: The LSE's Charlie Beckett takes a nuanced view of how the emerging breeds of niche newsletter creators fit into the overall evolution of the media ecosystem. He's clearly no more impressed with the general hype than I am, but the place he goes is valuable and interesting.
How can we take the best of the lessons from individual content creators, be they influencers or newsletter successes, and incorporate them into bigger news organisations?

But the idea of a ‚Äònews organisation‚Äô at scale with an established brand, history and audience is valuable. I have long argued that these fortresses need to open up, become more diverse in their workforce and content, adapt to new networks and build more interactive, engaged relationships with their audiences. Mainstream journalism needs to be reinvented.
As an industry, we're really not good enough ‚Äî yet ‚Äî at looking around ourselves and learning lessons from outside journalism. We need to do more of it.
